problem: A square has a side length of 5 cm. What is the greatest possible length of a diagonal in this square? Give the answer in decimal and round to 2 decimal places
solution: The diagonal of a square is calculated as the side length multiplied by the square root of 2. Therefore, the diagonal length is $5 \times \sqrt{2} = 5 \times 1.414 = 7.07$ cm. \(\boxed{7.07}\)
